DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator to ask if a patient has a medical history for myocardial infarction.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a prior myocardial infarction in a patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area. (Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Myocardial infarction
ReferenceDocuments.description: Myocardial infarction

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you ever had a heart attack

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of myocardial infarction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a  myocardial infarction within the past 180 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a myocardial infarction within 12 months of today?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient ever had a myocardial infarction (heart attack)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of myocardial infarction (MI)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence of recent myocardial infarction or ischemia by the findings of S-T elevations of greater than or equal to 2mm using the analysis of an EKG performed within 14 days prior to step 2 registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence of recent myocardial infarction or ischemia by the findings of S-T elevations of greater than or equal to 2mm using the analysis of an EKG performed within 7 days prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence of recent myocardial infarction or ischemia by the findings of S-T elevations of greater than or equal to 2mm using the analysis of an EKG performed within 7 days prior to step 2 registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence of recent myocardial infarction or ischemia by the findings of S-T elevations of greater than or equal to 2mm using the analysis of an EKG performed within 28 days prior to step 2 registration (Note: EKG to be performed only if clinical suspicion of cardiac issue)

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the myocardial infarction occur more than 6 months prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does participant have a history of myocardial infarction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of recent myocardial infarction or ischemia by the findings of S-T elevations of ≥ 2 mm using the analysis of an EKG performed within 28 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of myocardial infarction within 6 months

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of recent myocardial infarction or ischemia by the findings of S-T elevations of greater than or equal to 2 mm using the analysis of an EKG performed within 28 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Myocardial infarction <= 3 months prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have myocardial infarction within the last 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to the anticipated start date of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 6 months prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior myocardial infarction?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Chronic Disease Ind-3 (2018845v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
